title: For Sale/Trade:   Custom Rock River free float tactical AR15
postcontent:
Up for sale is my Rock River AR15.  I bought the upper a few years ago from here: http://www.pkfirearms.com/RRA_Custom_Uppers/208/c and paid $650 for it.  It is the one with the 10" troy rail and a 16" midlength lightweight profile barrel.  The barrel is chrome lined and has a twist rate of 1in9.  The lower is a RRA as well, and contains mostly rock river parts.  Here is a list of all other parts that I have added on:
Failzero BCG with hammer ($210)
BCM Gunfighter pistol grip ($30)
BCM Gunfighter charging handle ($40)
Magpul Badlever ($30)
Matech rear sight ($100)
Troy HK folding front sight ($100)
Magpul ACS buttstock ($110)
YHM Phantom flash hider ($25)
Bushnell AR Optics 1-4x tactical BDC scope and millett 30mm mount ($200)
Had the rifle professionally Cerakoted in flat dark earth ($200)

As you can tell, I have right around $1,900 in this rifle, pre-panic.  Everything on this rifle is high end, except the scope setup which is what most would consider mid-range.  There is no tapco or NCstar crap on it.  It has had approximately 1,500 rounds through it and during that time not a single malfunction of any kind.  There are only two minor issues with it; both of which are common.  Issue 1:  It is impossible to fully seat a full 30rd mag into this rifle.  You have to load 26 or 27 rounds into a 30rd mag to get them to latch in.  issue 2:  Apparently, Rock River makes their buffer tubes a bit smaller in diameter than everybody else.  This means that the ACS stock does not latch down as solidly as it could on a regular milspec tube.  It does not effect function whatsoever.  I remedied most of this issue with some aluminum ductwork tape in a few strategic spots on the buffer tube.  It could easily be removed if you like.  You can't see it until you pull the stock out passed the second or third closest in position.  Anyways, I would sell the rifle as it sits (minus the laser sight on the rail system; which is not for sale) for $1,300.  Text me at 317-529-72nine nine I am open to partial trade offers.  I don't want your compound bow, muzzle loader, or high point.  Not interested in project cars, campers, or fishin' boats.  I like high end tactical guns, plain and simple.  If what you have to offer to trade doesn't fall into that category then please do not contact me.

location: Spring Lake Park, Minneapolis / St. Paul, Minnesota
postcontent:
Yugoslavian Zastava M70AB-2T Underfolding AK-47 7.62x39 semi auto rifle. These are one of the finest imported AK’s money can buy. You can find plenty of new and surplus ammo for these rifles at the right price (as cheap as 20 cents a round!) and they are a blast to shoot! Comes with two 30rd mags, original surplus cleaning kit, box, and paperwork. Imported by Century Arms Int’l. Pistol permit and backround check is required to purchase this rifle.
$799
History of M70 automatic rifle

During the 1970th The opportunity arose and the other flag is tasked to initiate the production of AP and AP M70 M70A for the army. Model AP M70A was the folding butt. Home production of local varieties Kalashnikov began somewhere around the 1959th The first models appeared under the given name M64 for testing. Model had a familial south handle, closing the gas chamber for firing grenades and a few more things different than the original model of Kalashnikov assault as a handle that is different from the original. How are performance rifles were only satisfactory, the Yugoslav People’s Army is not accepted as a standard rifle infantry weapon.

Before the larger models of rifles made, reducing costs proizvododnji resulted in the removal of some parts of the frame and relocating the followers. In addition, the usual set pipe through the reciver is being replaced by cheaper extrusion tube reciver. Rifles produced with this new method are called AP M70B (with static butt) and AP M70AB2 (with foldingbutt).

As with the M70 series assault rifles, these models are not produced in large quantities before they are reduced production costs, which led again to a new model. This time the reciver reduced to a thickness of 0.9 mm, speed reducer cracking has been added to the trigger, and set the brake. Yugoslav Kalashnikovs with these characteristics are called AP M70B1 (with static butt) and AP M70AB1 (with folding butt).

These models are also coming to mass production, before the last alteration M70 rifle design resulted with models AP M70B2 (with static butt) and M70AB2 (with flip Kondakova). The latter two modes had reciver thickness 1.5mm thinner and reinforcing the front of the gun in an effort to strengthen the frequent firing grenades. These two models are widely produced in the M70 series, and have become the most widely used models in the JNA and on all sides during the war in Yugoslavia in the 1990s. Parts imported to America, show marks that are contradictory to the final model. On those parts of the printed label M70B1.

All models of the M70 family of AP share the possibility of firing grenades, extended grip with 3 cooling slots, iron tombstones with phosphorus or tritium to improve shooting night. Rifle are fire codes for the types of R – burst, S – single fire.

Design and features AP M70

M70 can be easily distinguished from other Kalashnikov assault rifles for 3 slots for cooling to handle, light colored wood grip, sight for firing grenades and black rubber coating on factory M70 rifles.

Reciver from AP M70 is 1.5mm thin, and compared with standard receivers Kalashnikov, it is more rigid. Besides the tube is not chrome-lined, making it more precise than the standard machine guns.

location: W/SW Metro, Minneapolis / St. Paul, Minnesota

For sale is one Romanian Model 1956 SKS, chambered in 7.62x39. This rifle is in good cosmetic condition and has an excellent bore (around 100 rounds through it), but it needs a little bit of work.

Its main problem is it has a bad gas tube which bleeds off gas, causing it to short stroke. 7/10 times it cycles properly, but it failed to hold the bolt open on the last round on every occasion. It has cycled properly with another gas tube, so i can confidently say it does work, just not with its current gas tube.

Other issues are its front sight is slightly canted and the trigger is a bit heavy.

More pics available upon request. Also have the butt plate and stock screws which I will include with the sale.

title: For Sale:  Re: Free
postcontent:
This gentleman is insisting that, in PA, long guns must be transferred through an FFL.  He is incorrect.  Only handguns must be transferred through an FFL in PA.  Long guns can be transferred via bill of sale.  Yes, an AR, AK, or a shotgun is considered a long gun (provided it has a minimum 16" barrel).

BTW, this guy is just a fear-mongering troll.  I contacted him and was given the good word of The Lord on gun transfers, or his version of it.  Personally, if the government doesn't need to be involved, don't let them be.  I've always found the shooting community does a good job of policing themselves.  As for civil liability, I'll take my chances, but I doubt it would be an issue.

Please check your state laws before performing any firearm transaction, or opening your mouth to spout off some incorrect information.

Original post: http://www.armslist.com/posts/2769076/pennsylvania-rifles-for-sale--free-

postcontent:
This is a brand new in box Glock 19 Generation 3 compact semi-automatic pistol chambered in 9mm. This Glock features a unique, limited edition Olive Drab Green frame. The GLOCK 19 is ideal for a versatile role because of its reduced dimensions when compared to the standard sized option. Chambered in 9x19, the G19 has found worldwide acclaim with both private and public security agencies. In addition to being used as a conventional service pistol, it is ideal for concealed carry or as a backup weapon. Trigger pull weight is a comfortable 5.5 pounds and trigger travel is a crisp .5".

The GLOCK, non-fiberglass, reinforced polymer frame helped revolutionize the handgun industry by delivering a new standard in high-impact resistance, durability, and extended life all while significantly reducing weight. All GLOCK metal parts are treated with a Nitration finishing process that optimizes the molecular structure of those surfaces. This progressive technology delivers a high degree of surface hardness, maximum durability, and exceptional corrosion resistance, that provides many years of trouble-free service under the harshest environmental conditions.

GLOCK barrels are manufactured using a cold-hammer forging method, with surface treatment and rounded interior profiles allowing for uniform precision and consistency—even after a high number of rounds have been fired. Plus, polygonal rifling leads to a better gas seal that translates to higher velocities, increased accuracy, and a substantial reduction in maintenance.

This pistol includes a speed loader and ships in a Glock branded padded hard case

This is a brand new in box Glock 23 Generation 4 pistol chambered in .40 S&W. This Glock features a unique, limited edition Olive Drab Green frame. The GLOCK 23 Gen4, in .40, introduces revolutionary design changes to the pistol that combines compact dimensions for both open and concealed carry, with minimum weight-despite its large magazine capacity. The Modular Back Strap design lets you instantly customize its grip to adapt to an individual shooter's hand size, , including the popular new beavertail backstrap. The surface of the frame employs the new scientifically designed, real-world-tested, Gen4 rough textured technology. Internally, the new GLOCK dual recoil spring assembly substantially increases the life of the system. A reversible magazine catch, changeable in seconds, accommodates left or right-handed operators. The GLOCK, non-fiberglass, reinforced polymer frame helped revolutionize the handgun industry by delivering a new standard in high-impact resistance, durability, and extended life all while significantly reducing weight. All GLOCK metal parts are treated with a Nitration finishing process that optimizes the molecular structure of those surfaces. This progressive technology delivers a high degree of surface hardness, maximum durability, and exceptional corrosion resistance, that provides many years of trouble-free service under the harshest environmental conditions.

GLOCK barrels are manufactured using a cold-hammer forging method, with surface treatment and rounded interior profiles allowing for uniform precision and consistency—even after a high number of rounds have been fired. title: For Sale:  Ithaca M-49 .22 Rifle
postcontent:
Ithaca lever action M-49 short, long, long rifle .22 caliber. (Yes shoots all 3 types of bullets) Rifle looks like a Winchester M-49. It's a single shot .22. You load one round at a time in the breech after pulling down the lever, close the lever, pull back the hammer and then shoot. Pull down the lever again and the shell ejects. Load your second .22 round and repeat.  Rifle is 35 " overall length. This is an older 1960's model based on the serial number. Wood stock is in great shape Someone did a fine job using some nice grain wood and refinishing it. It has Original Ithaca butt plate. The only problem with this weapon is some of the metal near the breech appears to be painted black. In no way affects the use of the weapon. I've seen some M49's sold on gunbroker.com for nearly $180. I'm asking $125 or trade for U.S. silver coins or .22 pistol.  Because of the Colorado Democrats, you are now required to submit to a background check for private sales. I know a place in Littleton that charges $25 for the transfer paperwork. (A place called rapid fire bunker) One good thing is you don't have to pay any sales tax!!!!! So that will save you around 8% of the sales price. If you want more pictures or other info, text me at REDACTED or email me.

title: For Sale:  Mossberg MVP 5.56/.223 bolt action rifle
postcontent:
I have a Mossberg MVP 5.56/.223 bolt action rifle for sale. This rifle is brand new, still in the original factory plastic, only removed for pictures. It is unfired and absolutely unused in anyway. I purchased this rifle new from Gander Mountain not very long ago for an upcoming hunting trip. Well, the trip fell through and I really have no need for this rifle. That said, I don't NEED to sell it either so please don't waste my time or yours with low ball type offers. 

Some fun facts about this rifle, most of which is why I end up deciding on this model:

- It can shoot both 5.56 and .223 ammo (unlike most .223 bolt actions that can only shoot .223 ammo). I have several AR's and have a lot of 5.56 ammo accumulated and t's nice to know I can shoot the 5.56 with this rifle as well.
- It has a fully adjustable trigger, as in the owner can adjust it in about 5 minutes without needing any fancy tools or an expensive gunsmith. 
- The barrel is 1:9 twist, meaning is can properly stabilize up to 69 grain ammo. Many .223 bolt action rifles are 1:12 twist meaning they cannot effectively shoot anything higher than 55 grain ammunition. This is important for distance shooting and accuracy.
- This rifle is designed to use standard AR15 magazines. Yup, you read that correctly. any size or form of standard AR15 magazine fits fine (ex. 5/10/20/30 rounders, polymer type like Magpul or metal type like issued by the military...all work in this rifle). No more trying to hunt down specific hard to find magazines, only to pay through the nose.
- Military spec bolt (meaning it is both durable, lightweight, and effective)
- Fluted barrel for reduced weight and heat dissipation. 
- Integral Weaver-style 2-piece bases for such things as optics

Here is a link to the exact rifle I purchased from the place I bought it from:
http://www.gandermountain.com/modperl/product/details.cgi?pdesc=Mossberg-MVP-Varmint-Centerfire-Rifle&i=721783&r=view&from=grid

I paid approx $685 for rifle with tax. I am willing to take a bit of a loss, within reason, after all it is still brand new unfired. I think $600 is an extremely fair price. I also have a nice unused rifle butt-stock pouch that holds extra ammo and other stuff as well. I will include this as well for $20 (paid $45 for it). Not looking for any trades at this time.

To purchase - must be at least 18 years of age with a valid government issued ID. FTF only, no shipping. Willing to meet in the Akron area. CHL/CCW holders preferred.

title: For Sale:  Polish PPS-43C semi auto pistol 35 round mags NIB
location: Greene County SW Illinois, Illinois, United States
postcontent:
No sales to Chicago or Cook County. I use the State Police FOID verification system. This also has the 72 hour waiting period.
•Caliber: 7.62x25 mm TT
•Weight: 3.67 kg loaded, 3.04 kg empty
•Length: 615 Barrel length 250 mm
•Magazine Capacity 35 rounds 5 mags included.
•Effective range:200 meters

The History...

The PPS-43C (Pistolet-Pulemet Sudaeva, model of 1943 = Sudaev SMG) was born as an answer to the need for a weapon that is more compact and mobile than the PPSh-41, then in use by the Soviet Army. The PPSh-41 was somewhat too long to be used by tank crews and mobile recon groups and paratroopers, so late in 1941, the Red Army issued a request for a new more compact sub machine gun (SMG). The designer Sudaev initially designed his new SMG in 1942, and it was adopted under the designation of PPS-42. The next year he refined the design, and this final model was designated as the PPS-43. This model was manufactured in significant numbers (nearly two million PPS-43 weapons were manufactured between 1943 and 1946). The PPS-43 is sometimes referred to as the best SMG of World War II. After WWII, it was widely exported to pro-Soviet regimes around the world, and widely copied.

title: For Sale:  Mossberg MVP 5.56/.223 bolt action rifle
postcontent:
I have a Mossberg MVP 5.56/.223 bolt action rifle for sale. This rifle is brand new, still in the original factory plastic, only removed for pictures. It is unfired and absolutely unused in anyway. I purchased this rifle new from Gander Mountain not very long ago for an upcoming hunting trip. Well, the trip fell through and I really have no need for this rifle. That said, I don't NEED to sell it either so please don't waste my time or yours with low ball type offers. 

Some fun facts about this rifle, most of which is why I end up deciding on this model:

- It can shoot both 5.56 and .223 ammo (unlike most .223 bolt actions that can only shoot .223 ammo). I have several AR's and have a lot of 5.56 ammo accumulated and t's nice to know I can shoot the 5.56 with this rifle as well.
- It has a fully adjustable trigger, as in the owner can adjust it in about 5 minutes without needing any fancy tools or an expensive gunsmith. 
- The barrel is 1:9 twist, meaning is can properly stabilize up to 69 grain ammo. Many .223 bolt action rifles are 1:12 twist meaning they cannot effectively shoot anything higher than 55 grain ammunition. This is important for distance shooting and accuracy.
- This rifle is designed to use standard AR15 magazines. Yup, you read that correctly. any size or form of standard AR15 magazine fits fine (ex. 5/10/20/30 rounders, polymer type like Magpul or metal type like issued by the military...all work in this rifle). No more trying to hunt down specific hard to find magazines, only to pay through the nose.
- Military spec bolt (meaning it is both durable, lightweight, and effective)
- Fluted barrel (20") for reduced weight and heat dissipation. 
- Integral Weaver-style 2-piece bases for such things as optics

Here is a link to the rifle I purchased from the place I bought it from:
http://www.gandermountain.com/modperl/product/details.cgi?pdesc=Mossberg-MVP-Varmint-Centerfire-Rifle&i=721783&r=view&from=grid

I am willing to take a bit of a loss, within reason, after all it is still brand new unfired. Price is $550. I also have a nice unused rifle butt-stock pouch and cheek pad that holds extra ammo and other stuff as well. I will include this in the deal (paid $45 for it).

To purchase - must be at least 18 years of age with a valid government issued ID. FTF only, no shipping. Willing to meet in the Akron area. CHL/CCW holders preferred.

title: For Sale:  Surefire X400 Ultra
postcontent:
X400® Ultra — Red Laser
LED Handgun or Long Gun WeaponLight with Laser

Specifications

Max Output -- White Light	500	.0	lumens
Tactical Runtime*	1	.5	hours
Max Output -- Laser	5	.0	mW
Length	3	.6	inches
Bezel Diameter	1	.125	inches
Weight w/Batteries	4	.9	ounces
Batteries	2		123A  (included)
*Runtime (at highest setting for multiple-output lights) until output drops below 50 lumens
Description

X400U-A-RD
The SureFire X400 Ultra WeaponLight integrates stunningly powerful white-light illumination and bright red laser aiming capabilities in one compact rail-mountable package, an extremely effective combination for close- to medium-range engagements in law enforcement, military, and self-defense applications. 

A high-performance LED generates 500 lumens of brilliant white light that is focused by a Total Internal Reflection (TIR) lens to produce a tight beam with extended reach and significant surround light for peripheral vision. The X400 Ultra produces tactical-level light—enough to overwhelm an aggressor's dark-adapted vision—for 1.5 hours per set of batteries. 

The X400 Ultra’s 5-milliwatt laser sight, located below the primary light, emits a high-visibility red (635 nM) beam. The laser's aiming adjustment mechanism uses Nylok® screws that won't back out from the effects of recoil, which means it rarely needs to be re-zeroed. 

Activating the X400 Ultra is done is done via ambidextrous switching located at the rear of body, providing one-finger control — press the switch on either side for momentary-on activation, flip up or down for constant-on activation. A separate switch at the rear of the X400 Ultra allows you to (1) activate white light illumination only, (2) activate white light illumination simultaneously with the laser sight, (3) activate the laser sight only, or (4) disable the entire X400 Ultra. See illustration at upper left. 

Optional DG grip switches (for pistols) and a pressure activated XT07 tape switch (for long guns) permit the X400 Ultra to be activated without altering your grip on your weapon. 

The versatile X400 Ultra can be attached to a pistol or a long gun since its Rail-Lock® system permits rapid attachment/detachment from either Universal or Picatinny rails. Its high-strength aerospace aluminum body is Mil-Spec hard anodized for superior toughness and corrosion resistance and is O-ring and gasket sealed to keep out dust and moisture. 

FITS: Handguns and long guns with Picatinny or Universal rails. Adapter mounts available for several non-railed handguns—click here to view them.
Features
Virtually indestructible 500-lumen LED regulated to maximize output and runtime
High-visibility 5 mW red laser sight
TIR lens for close- to medium-range applications
Quick-detach rail clamp with adapters for Picatinny and Universal rails
Accepts optional pistol grip and long gun forend switches
Construction—High-strength aerospace aluminum with Mil-Spec anodizing; impact-resistant polymer; coated tempered window
Weatherproof—O-ring and gasket sealed
Includes high-energy 123A batteries with 10-year shelf life

title: For Sale/Trade:  AR-15 Complete UPPER   NIB
postcontent:
AR-15 Upper Complete These are really nice, Function Tested, and ready to drop in to any lower and start firing... 

Upper is machined from 7075-T6 forgings that are hard coat anodized for wear and scratch resistance meeting MIL SPEC

Barrels drilled, reamed and buttoned from 4140, 4150 Chrome Moly, Chrome Moly Vanadium per MIL –B-11595E or 
416 stainless gun quality steel then stress relieved prior to contouring and chambering. 

Twist rate is 1 in 9. The barrels are chambered in the highly desireable .223 Wylde and therefore chambered for and suitable for firing either the Nato 5.56 designation or the .223 Remington commercial round. 


The head space is set and the barrel is tested for straightness using a 6” drop pin gage. 

The steel barrel assemblies are Parkerized to eliminate rusting. Bolts machined from tool steel, hardened and tempered 
to provide maximum wear characteristics then Parkerized to eliminate rusting. 

Bolt carriers machined from 8620 gun quality steel, heat treated and tempered to maximize strength and wear characteristics then Parkerized to eliminate rusting. These work great with our complete lowers...

The barrels on these are made from 4140 cold rolled steel and are rated at a barrel life of approximately 150,000 rounds. They are very top end. 

They are not chrome lined as most AR-'s are not. Chrome lining on modern rifles is typically used where there is a high probability of corrosive ammo being used such as AK type rifles chambered for foreign calibers... 

Since chrome lining may slightly affect accuracy, and since most AR-15 rifles are designed with accuracy as a benchmark, 
and since virtually all .223 / 5.56 Nato is non corrosive...most AR manufacturers do not chrome line barrels. 


* No FFL required on the uppers as they are not the serial numbered part and not considered a firearm.
These can and should ship directly to the end user.
TRADE VALUE 699.00 352.634.2o84 private owner

Manufacturer's Description
Complete AR-15 Flat Top Upper by Bear Creek Arsenal
